entry.title: [uia] Added new UIA-only value for AXEmbeddedObjectBehavior
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new enum value for AXEmbeddedObjectBehavior

called `kUIAExposeCharacterForTextContent`

to fix issues we have run into.

These issues stem from scenarios where UIA APIs are used, and we end up

going through a code path that uses IA2 logic.



For instance, the Macros on AXPlatformNodeTextrangeProviderWin make

sure positions are valid by calling `AXPosition::AsValidPosition`.

In our specific case, we would go down a path where inside this func

we then call `CreatePositionAtEndOfAnchor` which then attempts

to create a TextPosition with offset = `MaxTextOffset()`.



Within `MaxTextOffset()` we fall into the scenario where

`GetAnchor()->GetHypertext().length()` is called. However, this is IA2

specific logic, and it is being used by UIA APIs which lead to wrong

behavior.



As such, this CL introduces `kUIAExposeCharacter` which is leads to

behavior similar to `kExposeCharacter` simply without the IA2 specific

logic and calculations.



Moreover, this CL also introduces new logic to

`TextRangeProvider::FindText`. We used to previously subtract

the number of appended newlines to the found range, however this

was not correct behaviour when in cases where the newlines appended

were after the range found, which then made it so we unnecessarily

shortened the range. This CL changes `AXRange::GetText` so that

instead of getting the number of appended newlines as an out parameter

it now gets a vector of the indices in the range where those appended

newlines were added as an out parameter. This way, FindText can

shorten the range only when the appended newlines are within the

relevant range.



Change-Id: Iac6369c1e8012e446807ba02720f46a6e2c10972

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4786934

Commit-Queue: Javier Contreras

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187935}

entry.title: [APS] Fix omnibox not gaining focus on the NTP when a hardware keyboard
entry.content:
is connected



Currently, the omnibox focus set by

LocationBarMediator#showUrlBarCursorWithoutFocusAnimations() is cleared

due to the unfocus logic in LocationBarMediator#setUrl() because of two

invocations of setUrl() that occur after the call to the former when the

NTP is opened - at the time of the first invocation the NTP URL is empty

and therefore the omnibox is unintentionally unfocused.



This CL attempts to remove the unfocus logic from setUrl() to overcome

this and control focus / unfocus for this use case from one point -

ToolbarManager#maybeShowCursorInLocationBar() will be repurposed to do

this.



Bug: 1445822

Change-Id: Ie83bc518f2513c45b416d8b1cf0ce7f9baec1ac7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4803169

Reviewed-by: Patrick Noland

entry.title: webauthn: don't restart requests after non-automatic dispatch to iCKC.
entry.content:
The `priority_mechanisms_index_` member was not ephemeral state, but

should have been. Without this change, if iCKC was auto-dispatched

initially, every time the user cancels it we'll restart the request, but

that should only happen once.

entry.title: [TTF] Remove NotifyFocusChangeComplete from PasswordGenerationAgent
entry.content:
The method is used only to set the currently focused password field. We

can always track the currently focused element using the call to

AutofillAgent::focused_element().

PasswordAutofillAgent::focused_element() was introduced, which simply

redirects the call to AutofillAgent to expose it for the

PasswordGenerationAgent (the generation agent doesn't have access to the

autofill agent).

entry.title: Make sure remote RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa instances have correct visibility.
entry.content:
When (re)creating a remote RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa we need to make

sure the view is hidden if it is supposed to be to make sure input

events are routed correctly. Without this when a WebContents with for

example a page in the bfcache is reparented into a remote window it is

possible for the RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa for the bfcached page to

end up above the view for the currently visible page, resulting in

input events not propagating.



This at least fixes an issue with tabbed PWAs where tab switching can

trigger this, and hopefully this also fixes a much more flaky issue on

PWA installation (where a WebContents is also reparented into a remote

window).

entry.title: [Sync] Populate incoming password invitation unencrypted fields
entry.content:
For all other data types, the specifics are either:

1- Fully encrypted, in which case the worker needs to to decrypt before passing over the specifics to other layers in Sync.

2- Unencrypted, in which case the worker needs to only carry over

all fields before passing the specifics to other layers.



However, IncomingPasswordSharingInvitationSpecifics are special in the

sense that they contains a mix of both encrypted and unencrypted

fields, and hence it require both:

Carry over unencrypted fields, and decrypting encrypting fields.

So far the unencrypted has been ignored.



This CL adds the logic for carrying over unencrypted fields together

with the proper testing.

entry.title: Refactor MetricsService (no-op)
entry.content:
1.

Changes a method name to make it clear that the log was produced

asynchronously.



2.

Moves a call to OnDidCreateMetricsLog() around. This is a no-op. The

call that was moved is only called for async logs. There is only one

call site for async log, which is OnFinalLogInfoCollectionDone().



Before this CL, the call stack looks like:

-> OnFinalLogInfoCollectionDone()

-> CloseCurrentLog(async=true)

-> SnapshotUnloggedSamplesAndFinalizeLog() (on background thread)

-> MaybeCleanUpAndStoreFinalizedLog() (back on main thread)

-> OnDidCreateMetricsLog()



After this CL, it will look like:

-> OnFinalLogInfoCollectionDone()

-> CloseCurrentLog(async=true)

-> SnapshotUnloggedSamplesAndFinalizeLog() (on background thread)

-> MaybeCleanUpAndStoreFinalizedLog() (back on main thread)

-> StoreFinalizedLog()

-> OnAsyncPeriodicOngoingLogStored()

-> OnDidCreateMetricsLog()



The reason for this is that it is more correct, semantically speaking.

entry.title: [iOS] Stop HistorySyncPopupCoordinator before creating a new one
entry.content:
In Recent Tabs, it's possible to start a new HistorySyncPopupCoordinator

before the previous one is stopped, if the user taps on the promo

button before the end of the dismiss animation of the previous screen.



The DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK in dealloc is triggered in this case, as it was

added to prevent the coordinator from being deallocated when it's not

stopped.



This CL stops the previous coordinator when a new one is created to fix

the issue.

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: Handle timestamps in V4L2StatefulVD decoding
entry.content:
This CL relands https://crrev.com/c/4680016, which was reverted due

to some broken timestamping for ARC CTS testing. PS0 contains the

reverted CL and subsequent patches the fixes, which are basically

just not touching ToT code and leaving TODO()s instead.



Original CL description -------------------------------------------



This CL handles the timestamps during decoding in V4L2StatefulVD,

namely stores the incoming DecoderBuffer timestamp and uses it to

tag the produced decoded VideoFrame. V4L2 uses struct timevals

while Chrome likes base:TimeDelta, so this CL adds two helper

functions in v4l2_utils.cc to translate back and forth.

entry.title: [Autofill] Remove {Autofill,PasswordManager}Driver::GetAxTree()
entry.content:
This CL removes AutofillDriver::GetAxTree() and

PasswordManagerDriver::GetAxTree() and instead calls RFH::GetAxTree()

in directly AutofillPopupControllerImpl.



ContentAutofillDriver::GetAxTree() was arguably incorrect because it

did not get routed to the right driver's RFH. Since GetAxTree() gets

no form parameter, it's unclear how the event even could have been

routed. Calling GetAxTree() on the *focused* RFH in

AutofillPopupControllerImpl should fix this.

entry.title: Clarify the use of *_once test groups in test_suites.pyl
entry.content:
We added these *_once groups specifically for some py unittest suites

that have no need to run on any more than one bot per desktop platform.



But their existence is causing some confusion, and are being used to

add large non-trivial suites to just CQ bots. That's not really an

intended use for the *_once groups, since if someone spins-up a

dbg or sanitizer version of a CQ builder, it would want to run all

suites of that CQ builder that would be affected by those GN args.



So this clarifies the purpose of the *_once test groups in comments.

entry.title: [Sync] Change DecryptSharingInvitation method signature
entry.content:
Since the name of the method

DecryptIncomingPasswordSharingInvitationSpecifics() is very specific

to incoming password sharing invitation, the signature should also

reflect that and accept only the required information instead of the

generic sync_pb::EntitySpecifics.

Mainly benefit of this is to make clearer at the caller site that this

method doesn't populate the whole specifics out proto.



Some fields are missing from the proto (the unencrypted fields), and

follow-up CL will fix that.





This is a purely mechanical CL.

entry.title: Fix uninstallation of USB printers
entry.content:
Currently, the method CupsPrintersManager::UninstallPrinter(...) is

called only when a user removes saved printer or detaches USB printer.

Unfortunately, it does not work correctly for USB printers, because the

method GetPrinter(...) called inside always returns nullptr (for USB

printers). This patch fixes this issue by introducting two changes:

1. Move a call to the histogram Printing.CUPS.PrinterRemoved from

OnRemovedPrinter(...) to RemoveSavedPrinter(...). Currently, the

histogram is called only when the method UninstallPrinter(...) is

called inside RemoveSavedPrinter(...), so this change allows to keep

the histogram working the same way as before.

2. Remove the condition from UninstallPrinter(...) blocking the call to

CupsRemovePrinter(...). The call to GetPrinter(...) is not needed

any more, since it was added there only to provide data for the

histogram.

I have tested this patch on atlas and confirmed that USB printers are

removed from CUPS when disconnected from chromebook. In the previous

versions, configured USB printers were left in CUPS and never removed.

I have also confirmed that this bug occurred in the version 115.



BUG=none

TEST=tested on atlas



Change-Id: Ia37779dcefdeb704f3d45894b560746445f9af7e

entry.title: [ZPS][Journeys] Utilize hybrid strategy for ZPS/Journeys integration.
entry.content:
The initial iteration of the "related searches" ZPS/Journeys integration

logic (as implemented by crrev.com/c/4090705) was able to successfully

overcome some of the flakiness associated with the traditional DOM

extraction approach by sourcing "related searches" from prefetched ZPS

response data.



One consequence of this approach was that the "related searches"

annotations provided by the ZPS prefetch logic would often completely

overwrite those supplied by the SRP DOM extraction flow. Based on

feedback from others, it turned out that the SRP-derived "related

searches", which were now being overwritten by the integration logic,

were often qualitatively better than those provided by the ZPS prefetch

flow.



After some further discussion, it was determined that the ideal approach

would be to augment (rather than overwrite) the set of SRP-derived

"related searches" using data obtained via the ZPS prefetching infra. As

such, this CL updates the current ZPS/Journeys integration to implement

this new strategy, thereby resulting in increased "related searches"

coverage in Journeys without having to sacrifice any annotations

obtained via DOM extraction on SRP.



Furthermore, prior to this CL, the ZPS prefetch flow could attempt to

add "related searches" annotations before the relevant visit was added

to the history DB. Given the async nature of both history DB updates and

ZPS prefetching, this resulted in a potential race condition which could

trigger annotation failures due to a missing entry in the history DB.

This CL eliminates this race condition by ensuring that the ZPS-derived

annotations are only added AFTER any SRP-derived annotations.



BEFORE/AFTER screenshots:



- Query = "tom cruise": https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1va_4RP5NGby9ERQx0GjtUtEfh76NOVJ3?resourcekey=0-3MPRDgGnI_nPF3mbvnGzgQ&usp=sharing

- Query = "turtle": https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1rHOIPvub4_qU3EvHA8Cat3dA5I63lfFV?resourcekey=0-F0ljShpwKDFAXC3wPyHv_Q&usp=sharing

entry.title: Move the focus element clearing to after all layouts.
entry.content:
When we do a window resize, the layout can repeat a couple of times

if we have fixed position elements. This is a consequence of the

following:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/local_frame_view.cc;l=835;drc=93f41097bb9b07efd4b8e7e4536b8bf920baa915



This can cause us to mark LayoutView as needing layout.



Prior to this patch, we'd check if we need to clear the focused element

in PostStyleUpdateScope::Apply, invoked here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/local_frame_view.cc;l=3250;drc=93f41097bb9b07efd4b8e7e4536b8bf920baa915



Note that this would have NeedsLayout() as true, even though we just

performed layout. This is because of above: the layout view needs

layout.



As a part of checking whether we can clear a focused element, we check

if that element is focusable:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/document.cc;l=2715;drc=93f41097bb9b07efd4b8e7e4536b8bf920baa915



Through a few functions we end up in the code that causes us to update

style and layout:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/element.cc;l=5489;drc=acd0e1034f101c2ef8bafa49186bcb84e550dc27



Now, this call has an early out that says that if we don't need an update then don't do the update:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/document.cc;l=2409;drc=acd0e1034f101c2ef8bafa49186bcb84e550dc27



However, this function has some interesting checks. Specifically, it

says that if we need a layout, and the style may depend on layout

(ie there's a container query affecting this), then we may need to do

the update!:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/document.cc;l=2372-2378;drc=acd0e1034f101c2ef8bafa49186bcb84e550dc27



This causes us to call the UpdateStyleAndLayout which DCHECKs because

it is now a recursive call.



So, the things that we need for this to happens is a focused element,

a window resize, and a container query.



The solution in this patch is to just move where we clear the focused

element to be after all of the layouts, specifically after we know

LayoutView is clean (unless there's some other unrelated bugs), which

means that the focusability check will now early out from the update,

which is what we want.



Another solution that I tried in PS1 is to have a version of isfocusable

that doesn't do the update, but that's a deep rabbit hole because of

all the virtuals involved.



R=andruud@chromium.org



Fixed: 1448445

Change-Id: Ibabf1729ad6353c84bacc0764ba6e0f2adcb2916

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4804705

Commit-Queue: Vladimir Levin

Reviewed-by: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187823}

This converts the bid into state and injects it into the auction. This does not yet deal with the actual negative targeting and signature steps; and may need additional refinement around some of the features and k-anononymity. Alternative names for reporting are also not implemented yet. As the feature is behind a separate flag, this state was considered acceptable.

entry.content:
This is required for cross-platform UI orchestration. Note that the

KeyedService is profile-scoped, while WebContents or its iOS equivalent

is how the UI will be orchestrated, which is what necessitates this

change. The ChromeAutofillClient will invoke a controller in a

plus_addresses path under chrome/browser/ui in a follow-up.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Update document pip windows for Chrome Refresh
entry.content:
This CL makes a few different UI updates to document picture-in-picture

windows for Chrome Refresh:



1) Updates the color of the new pageinfo icon. The new icon has a white

background that doesn't make sense with PiP always being in dark mode,

so this adds some code to override into dark colors instead.



2) Updates the back-to-tab and close button icons.



3) Updates the margins on the pageinfo button to match new specs.



4) Updates the pip foreground and background colors to match new specs.

entry.title: Revert "[FilesBulkPinning] Remove usage of network service for offline check"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c1b15d8fed55ece8d67232173d7d4c05841ff369.



Reason for revert:

Breaks DriveUploadHandlerTest.UploadFromMyFilesConnectionLostDuringUpload



Original change's description:

> [FilesBulkPinning] Remove usage of network service for offline check

>

> DriveIntegrationService tracks online/offline behaviour using the CrOS

> network state handler service and also tracks whether a device is on

> cellular using the Chrome network stack. The cellular functionality is

> available on the CrOS network state handler so let's prefer a single

> source of truth.

>

> Bug: b/296469096

> Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=DriveIntegrationServiceTest*

> Change-Id: I73022d7040cf73558a001a010db4a157623c7df7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4805483

> Reviewed-by: Franois Degros

> Commit-Queue: Ben Reich

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187672}

entry.title: Create VisitedLinkRow and VisitedLinkDatabase.
entry.content:
This CL implements the new struct VisitedLinkRow and the new class VisitedLinkDatabase, the first in a series of CLs to implement a new table in the HistoryDatabase. The next CL in this series will integrate the VisitDatabase and the VisitedLinkDatabase to ensure correct data deletion from both tables.



The VisitedLinkDatabase is a SQLite database that holds triple-key partitioned :visited links history info. It is independent from the currently unpartitioned VisitedLinks hash table. VisitedLinksWriter should NEVER alter this database.



In the future, VisitedLinkDatabase will provide the necessary state to rebuild the partitioned VisitedLinks hash table in the event of corruption and to delete specific partition keys from the hash table.



NOTE: this table should remain empty until fully integrated with the HistoryDatabase and VisitDatabase.

entry.title: Keep the visual transform and clip rectangle for some skip presentation cases.
entry.content:
During swap chain presentation, there are some cases that swap chain

is presenting the same images as last swap. Thus the video images

won't be redrawn within swap chain presenter.But the visual transform

and clip rectangle for DCLayerTree update need to keep the same as

the last presentation when desktop plane was removed.

entry.title: [Sync] Tolerate loss of key-pairs.
entry.content:
Returning a model error on key-pair inconsistency means that the user is locked out of sync. This cl tolerates such loss in favour of letting the user still be able to use sync. The consequence is such users won't be able to participate in initiation a password invitation or receiving one.



Also in such a state, new keys will be created again on the client and committed to the server.

entry.title: Adjust Desktop security settings page for hash-prefix real-time lookups
entry.content:
Changes:

- When the friendlier settings feature is enabled, modifies the primary

description of Safe Browsing standard protection.

- When the friendlier settings features is disabled, modifies the

second bullet point in the Safe Browsing standard protection

description.

- Modifies the help link at the top of the page. The new link location

is shown if either feature (friendlier settings or hash-prefix real-

time lookups) is enabled.



Note that the "off" branch for hash-prefix real-time lookups will be

long-lived, so this does not follow the general strategy of adding the

disabled case in the "FlagsDisabled" suite.



Bug: 1469956

entry.title: Revert "Run HangWatcher in zygote children"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 15b5ea3d27f335e48cadf72fc07dadbfcab7d470.



Reason for revert:

Makes all browser_tests fail in "Linux MSan Tests" builder due to

"Unexpected termination of a renderer process"



Original change's description:

> Run HangWatcher in zygote children

>

> On Linux and ChromeOS, the HangWatcher never runs in zygote children

> (renderers, gpu process, and some utility processes) because it's

> only called in ContentMainRunnerImpl::RunBrowser() and

> RunOtherNamedProcessTypeMain(), neither of which run in zygote children.

>

> It does get initialized on the main thread because that is run in

> ChromeMainDelegate::CommonEarlyInitialization(), which is called

> from RunZygote().

>

> The Linux sandbox cannot be started in a multithreaded process, so

> the children that need to apply a sandbox will only start the

> HangWatcher after applying the sandbox.

>

> Use of the HangWatcher in zygote children is gated by a new

> EnableHangWatcherInZygoteChildren base::Feature.

>

> Bug: 1290880, 1079808

> Change-Id: I553004b2002f5c193e7366c9699b891714f687e8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4194031

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

> Reviewed-by: Olivier Li

> Commit-Queue: Matthew Denton

> Reviewed-by: John Abd-El-Malek

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187409}



Bug: 1290880, 1079808

Change-Id: I547191ece003588e3217c85468c22e3aad283515

entry.title: Remove multiple coverage test types from builders running JS coverage
entry.content:
Code coverage module in recipe infra doesn't support processing

multiple test types for javascript. By removing the config lines, the

module will use default configs ("overall" test type only). The current

config line has no effect. A validation is recipe is being added in

crrev/c/4802840 to raise at such configs.

entry.title: sensors: Merge PlatformSensorProviderBase into PlatformSensorProvider.
entry.content:
Especially after https://crrev.com/c/1693763, there is very little

reason to keep both classes separate, and merging them makes it easier

to reason about the code.



PlatformSensorProvider was only providing a couple of static functions

and a public destructor for child classes. These can be easily moved

into PlatformSensorProviderBase without any user-visible effect.



Bug: 1278377

Change-Id: Ib2345e8db023915f2b3eb08f762df1f63e3ca798

entry.title: Add ui/gl unit test for full screen letterboxing.
entry.content:
Two major test scenarios are added. FullScreenLetterboxingResizeVideoLayer is used to test the size adjustment for video layer during full screen letterboxing.



FullScreenLetterboxingWithDesktopPlaneRemoval is used to test the desktop plane removal settings during full screen letterboxing.



Bug: 1466473
